title: Uruguay: Citi Sponsors 81 Graduates of Forge Foundation Program
summary: Montevideo, Uruguay - On Monday, December 5, 439 students graduated the Forge Foundation program in a ceremony at the Solís Theater. Eighty-one of the graduates were sponsored by the Citi Foundation, which was represented at the event by Uruguay Citi Country Officer Vivianne Caumont.
tag-1: Uruguay: Citi Sponsors 81 Graduates of Forge Foundation Program
tag-2: Montevideo, Uruguay – On Monday, December 5, 439 students graduated the Forge Foundation program in a ceremony at the Solís Theater. Eighty-one of the graduates were sponsored by the Citi Foundation, which was represented at the event by Uruguay Citi Country Officer Vivianne Caumont.
tag-3: Caumont participated in a panel discussion during the closing ceremony, telling the young graduates, "Citi works constantly to promote social progress by supporting economic and social development in the communities where we operate. We look for programs that have a real impact and transform people's lives in positive ways."
tag-4: Citi Uruguay played an active role in sponsoring the Retail Assistant courses offered as part of the Forge Foundation's training workshops. The courses, which help participants learn sales and business administration skills, have been offered in Uruguay since 2014 as part of Citi's global Pathways to Progress initiative.
tag-5: As part of this initiative, Caumont recalled, the Citi Foundation commissioned a study of 35 cities in November 2015 to gauge the level of their support for young people in their first job search. Young people in Latin America were the most optimistic (84 percent) about their economic future, the study found, and were characterized by a desire to own their own business. "The Forge Foundation's work is perfectly in line with our local corporate social responsibility strategy and our goal of helping young people get their first jobs," Caumont noted.
tag-6: Fernando Panizza, Director of Forge Uruguay, thanked the program's sponsors and underscored the importance of these types of partnerships. "We are very grateful to all of the institutions that support the foundation from day to day, joining with it in forging futures, building bridges and changing lives."
tag-7: According to Leticia Moreira, Head of Public Affairs and Corporate Social Responsibility Coordinator at Citi Uruguay: "The bank tries to support projects that promote social inclusion through education for children and young people in vulnerable situations and provide them with the tools they need to join the future labor market. We understand that young people are our future and that education is the key to social insertion. The Forge Foundation shares this goal and together we have an excellent partnership to pursue it."

tag-10: The Forge Foundation The Forge Foundation is a non-profit organization that helps low-income Latin American adolescents gain access to quality jobs by means of an innovative training and job placement program.
tag-11: The organization offers a Work Training program for young people between the ages of 16 and 22 from low-income families who are in their final year of public high school.
